sentences.sContent: She says the president may just be posturing.
sentences.sCn: 她说总统也许只是在作态。

words.tran: 故作姿态；摆姿势；并非由衷的言行
杂技演员；装腔作势的人；作出某种姿态的人

trans.tranCn: 摆出姿势， 装模作样
trans.tranOther: You can say that someone is posturing when you disapprove of their behaviour because you think they are trying to give a particular impression in order to deceive people
the way you position your body when sitting or standing
